content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic adenocarcinoma (tail)

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy

Histology:		Poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma pT3N1M0 (Stage IIB), R0 resection, CDK4/6 amplification positive

Current situation:	Post-operative surveillance

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She has completed 6 cycles of adjuvant modified FOLFIRINOX which finished on 15/4/24. Her post-chemotherapy CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests including CA19-9 are within normal range. She reports good energy levels with PS 0 and has returned to work full-time. The peripheral neuropathy that developed during chemotherapy has largely resolved. Her weight is stable at 68kg. The plan is for continued 3-monthly surveillance with next CT scan due in July 2024. She will be reviewed in clinic following those results.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 6 cycles of adjuvant modified FOLFIRINOX
Post-chemotherapy CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence

status_updates.value: Stage IIB pancreatic adenocarcinoma post surgery and adjuvant chemotherapy. No evidence of recurrence on latest imaging.
Peripheral neuropathy from chemotherapy now largely resolved
Review in clinic following CT scan results
